thread.title: High school roundup: Adirondack boys, Beaver River girls win Beaver River Invitational
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Adirondack boys, Beaver River girls win Beaver River Invitational

title: High school roundup: Adirondack boys, Beaver River girls win Beaver River Invitational
text:
A A 
BEAVER FALLS — Norwood-Norfolk’s Kyle Fulk turned in a time of 15 minutes, 57 seconds to win the boys varsity race at the Beaver River cross country invitational Saturday. 
Ryan O’Rourke placed second to help Adirondack win the team competition, while Connor Demo was third as host Beaver River claimed third place. 
Chaz Agen of Potsdam was fourth and Salmon River’s Tyler Shorette was fifth. 
Beaver River won the girls competition thanks to Taylor Moore (19:55) and Shauna Rice (20:26) taking second and fourth, respectively. 
Canton’s Grace Bessette won the girls race with a mark of 19:48. Malone’s Emily Pomainville helped the Huskies take second in the team event with a time of 19:58. 
Norwood-Norfolk was fourth and Watertown was fifth. 
SOUTH LEWIS 3RD AT RFA 
Morgan Burd took 11th place with a time of 21:28.3 to help the Falcons to a third-place finish in the girls race at the Bill Coughlin Invitational at Rome Free Academy. 
Sierra Corbett (21:50.5) was 13th for South Lewis. Host RFA won the team event, while Justyna Wilkinson of Whitesboro (19:07.7) won the race. 
In the boys race, Rowan Russell was the highest finisher for South Lewis at 39th. 
Canastota’s Adam Vanvalkenburgh won the race, while Liverpool took the team event. 
FOOTBALL 
MALONE 53, ST. LAWRENCE 14 
Camron Gallagher accounted for four touchdowns as the Huskies routed the Larries in a Northern Athletic Conference game at Brasher Falls. 
Gallagher ran eight times for 115 yards and had scoring runs of 17, 26 and 66. Gallagher also tossed a 68-yard TD pass to Brandon Woods for Malone (6-0). Zach Raymond carried 13 times for 93 yards and scored on TD runs of 1, 10 and 17 yards for the Huskies. 
Mark Crump supplied both touchdowns for St. Lawrence (3-3) on a 7-yard run and 27-yard TD reception from Isiah Lyon. 
BEAVER RIVER 43, COOPERSTOWN 6 
Matt Middleton threw for two touchdown passes as the Beavers routed the Hawkeyes in an National Football Foundation East Division game at Beaver Falls. 
Middleton found Daniel Erker from 22 yards out and Dustin Jones from 57 yards for Beaver River (5-2, 3-1), which played its first game on its new turf. Erker added a 22-yard scoring run. Reed Murphy tossed a 54-yard TD pass to Matthew Kilionski for the Beavers. 
Carmen Booan scored on a 1-yard TD plunge for Cooperstown (3-4, 1-3). 
BOYS SOCCER 
WATERTOWN 3, POTSDAM 0 
Aidan King scored twice and added an assist as the host Cyclones picked up a nonleague victory over the Sandstoners. 
Brian Netton contributed a goal and Caleb Kolb stopped five shots for Watertown (8-4-1). 
Ahmed Hmyene registered six saves for Potsdam (5-6-1). 
IHC 2, HARRISVILLE 0 
Jake Fusilli notched a goal and an assist as the host Cavaliers beat the Pirates in nonleague play. 
Zach Frechette scored and Will Magovney collected 10 saves for Immaculate Heart Central (11-2-1). 
Kevin Kapfer made nine saves for Harrisville (9-2-1). 
BLESSED VIRGIN MARY 6, BEAVER RIVER 3 
Atanasio Deravsquin and Michael Urankar each scored twice as the Saints beat the Beavers in the Old Forge Columbus Day Tournament, 
Andrew Page and Peter Hanson added goals for Blessed Virgin Mary (10-3). 
Dylan Terry scored twice for Beaver River (4-10). 
GIRLS SOCCER 
SACKETS HARBOR 4, HERMON-DEKALB 0 
Sarah Gray and Jamie Lynn Mendelson each provided a goal and an assist as the Patriots won a nonleague game over the Green Demons (2-11-1) at DeKalb Junction. 
McKenzie Martin and Kelsey Gonseth added goals for Sackets Harbor (13-1). 
EDWARDS-KNOX 2, COLTON-PIERREPONT 1 
Mackenzie Frary and Emily Lasher each scored as the Cougars edged the Colts in a nonleague game at South Colton. 
Kara Davis and Alyssa White shared the crease making 14 saves for Edwards-Knox (5-4-2). 
Kaiti Long handled 13 shots for Colton-Pierrepont (4-7-2).
